title: datalad annex remote: Provide configurable (or just "smart") weighting/ordering of URLs
body:
See https://git-annex.branchable.com/todo/assign_costs_per_URL_or_better_repo-wide___40__regexes__41__/ for more context etc.  `datalad` special remote could be used instead of "built-in" `web` remote if such prioritization is desired.

We could may be weight different download providers first, and/or just URLs based on regexes.  Then datasets could carry desired weighting within their `.datalad/config`.

Or, we could be "smarty pants" and just (via historical collection in cache, e.g. of the recent X size: time pairs per each `protocol://servername` we encountered) figure out which of the domains (URLs) is expected to be the "fastest" one.  I feel like we had some issue about that but failed to find it.  Such automagical decision making would be nice, but would be hard to "inherit"/propagate across different CI runs (one of the use cases e.g. `annex fsck` for https://github.com/dandi/dandisets/issues/11#issuecomment-831993490) and might need some clever design to not derail into choosing the suboptimal/slowest one.

May be that logic could even be reused for `clone` operation while going through candidates with the same priority.
